abstract.text: A heatmap.
Radius of influence of one heatmap point in pixels. Increasing the value makes the heatmap smoother, but less detailed.
on heatmap layers will return points within this radius.
Default value: 30. Minimum value: 1. The unit of heatmapRadius is in pixels.
Name of a source description to be used for this layer.
Required for all layer types except
, and
A stroked line.

A measure of how much an individual point contributes to the heatmap. A value of 10 would be equivalent to having 10 points of weight 1 in the same spot. Especially useful when combined with clustering.
Default value: 1. Minimum value: 0.
Note! This is an experimental feature. It can be changed or removed in future versions.
Similar to
but controls the intensity of the heatmap globally. Primarily used for adjusting the heatmap based on zoom level.
Default value: 1. Minimum value: 0.
The minimum zoom level for the layer. At zoom levels less than the minzoom, the layer will be hidden.

The global opacity at which the heatmap layer will be drawn.
Default value: 1. Value range: [0, 1]
Defines the color of each pixel based on its density value in a heatmap. Should be an expression that uses
as input.
Default value: [“interpolate”,[“linear”],[“heatmap-density”],0,“rgba(0, 0, 255, 0)”,0.1,“royalblue”,0.3,“cyan”,0.5,“lime”,0.7,“yellow”,1,“red”].

This property defines whether the
uses colorTheme from the style or not.
By default it will use color defined by the root theme in the style.

A style’s fog property is a global effect that improves depth perception by fading out distant objects.
Rendering type of this layer.
The slot this layer is assigned to.
If specified, and a slot with that name exists, it will be placed at that position in the layer order.

The background color or pattern of the map.

A measure of how much an individual point contributes to the heatmap. A value of 10 would be equivalent to having 10 points of weight 1 in the same spot. Especially useful when combined with clustering.
Default value: 1. Minimum value: 0.
A pre-specified location in the style where layer will be added to
(such as on top of existing land layers, but below all labels).
Layer types that will also be removed if fallen below this clip layer.
